content.title: ACCEPTABLE USE POLICY
sections: 1. PURPOSE: This policy governs use of our services/platform.

2. PROHIBITED USES:
- Illegal activity
- Fraud or misrepresentation
- Infringing IP rights
- Uploading malware/viruses
- Hacking or unauthorized access (Computer Misuse Act)
- Denial of service attacks
- Spam or unsolicited marketing
- Harassing, abusive, or threatening content (Online Safety Act 2023)
- Hate speech or discrimination
- Child sexual abuse material (CSAM)
- Non-consensual intimate images
- Terrorist content
- False or misleading information causing harm
- Impersonation
- Excessive resource use affecting others

3. CONTENT STANDARDS:
- Must be accurate (where facts stated)
- Must be genuinely held (where opinions stated)
- Must comply with applicable law
- Must not be defamatory, obscene, or offensive
- Must not promote illegal activity
- Must respect others' privacy
4. MODERATION: We may (but are not obliged to) monitor, review, or remove content. We may use automated tools and human moderators.
5. REPORTING: Report violations to [REPORT_EMAIL]. We will investigate and may remove content/suspend users.

6. CONSEQUENCES:
- Warning
- Content removal
- Account suspension
- Account termination
- Reporting to authorities
- Legal action
7. NO LIABILITY: We are not liable for user content (subject to Online Safety Act duties).
8. COOPERATION: You must cooperate with investigations and legal requests.
9. CHANGES: We may update this policy. Check regularly.
content.online_safety_act_2025:
Under Online Safety Act 2023 (fully effective 2024-2025), platforms must:
- Take down illegal content (terrorism, CSAM, hate speech)
- Protect children from harmful content
- Assess and mitigate risks
- Provide reporting and complaints mechanisms
- Be transparent about content moderation
- Empower users with safety controls
